page.title: 05Unemployment in Alresford.
page.content: Unemployment levels are less than those nationally but this can be attributed to the class of the village. Alresford is essentially a middle class area and during a recession the types of jobs in which they are employed tend to be more secure because of the amount of skill and knowledge required. Many women in the village take on seasonal work, such as fruit picking, but they cannot be counted as unemployed because they do this work in addition to their primary role of housewives. To them employment is a supplement rather than a necessity.
